name: Oven Roasted Broccoli
headline: Oven Roasted Broccoli
description: Serve Alton Brown's top-rated Oven-Roasted Broccoli, topped with crunchy panko breadcrumbs and grated cheese, with this recipe from Good Eats on Food Network.
keywords: Easy Side Dish Recipes,Side Dish,Broccoli Side Dish,Broccoli,Roasted Broccoli,Roasted Vegetable,Roasting,Vegetarian,American,High Fiber
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup finely grated Parmesan or sharp Cheddar

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the broccoli florets into bite size pieces. Cut the stalk into 1/8-inch thick, round slices. Place the broccoli into a mixing bowl and toss with the olive oil, garlic, kosher salt and pepper and set aside.

Spread the panko into a 13 by 9-inch metal cake pan and place into the oven for 2 minutes or until lightly toasted. Remove the panko from the oven and add to the bowl with the broccoli mixture. Toss to combine. Return the mixture to the cake pan, place in the oven and roast just until the broccoli is tender, 8 to 10 more minutes. Remove from the oven, toss in the cheese and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: I added a little squeeze of lemon after pulling it out of the oven and it was awesome!
Super easy, delicious and versatile as a side dish.
Easy peezy! Definitely cook the panko on the stove top
Amazing! My kids went back for seconds and they are extremely picky eaters!

Amazing dish and so quick and easy! My daughter never liked cooked broccoli, but she requests this one often.  Today I'm making it for a party. We have a vegetarian friend and I'm always looking for a dish for her.  Well, this is the one!
Excellent tasting recipe, but toast the panko on the stove instead of in the oven. It’s much less likely to burn.
I could live off off of this vegetable dish, it is that good - I used parmesan and it was amazing.
Very tasty!! And easy.
Delicious! Five veggie stars for crisp, tender and flavorful broccoli.
Family loves.
Easy and very tasty.  Watch those breadcrumbs, they can go from browned to Burt very quickly. Broccoli was done perfectly in 10 minutes.
Delicious I could eat this every night for dinner nothing else needed
This is perfectly delicious every. single. time. Perfect veggie side
Sure beats steamed or boiled broccoli. Much yummier!
Just loved it! Didn’t put any cheese and was the best broccoli I ever ate!

I watched this video years ago and roasting broccoli is the only way to cook it! My husband hated broccoli until I roasted it - roasting makes the broccoli taste so much better that I don't even need cheese or breadcrumbs!
Tasty and quick to make!
I made this tonight. It was fantastic. Served it with Filet Mignon, baked Potatoes and home made rolls.. Family said it was a keeper!
This recipe was so easy and delicious!! I can’t wait to make it again. My whole family loved it!
Good!
So glad I discovered this recipe.  It’s so easy and so delicious.  Excited to have this as an option instead of always steaming broccoli.
Easy and so tasty!  This has become a family favorite!
Love

So good! Adjusted the measurements since we only had about a half pound of broccoli and the results were great.  The combo of panko and garlic works! This is hard to mess up. My new go to roasted broccoli recipe.
So delicious! Will definitely be making again soon!

Although this was indeed very tasty, it tasted much better uncooked. I added all the ingredients to the broccoli and was dipping it into the panko crumbs and I was nearly done while the oven was preheating. I told my husband to stop picking at it too and he said next time to not cook it haha. Very tasty snack I guess.

Easy.....

1st time trying it.
Made w Pork Ribs and Pasta book
OMG! This is delicious!
Made for dinner tonight....anything broccoli is always great no matter how it's fixed...so versatile.
Added chunks of sweet potato and roasted those 15 min first then added the broccoli to the sheet pan and roasted it

This recipe is fantastic - definitely a keeper!!  The panko gives it a delightful crunch, without the downside of additional oil or frying.  I also sprinkled a few pine nuts as a garnish, which rounded out the flavor and added an additional savory element.  I am planning to put this in our regular rotation, especially for meals that tend to be carb-heavy.  Thanks, Alton!
Love love love.

I have never had roasted broccoli before but wanted to try it! This dish was awesome and we will make it again! The kids usually do not eat broccoli but they enjoyed this version.  It was easy to make and was delicious!
The best broccoli ever!
This is so delicious! And very easy. I did it exactly as written. A new family favorite!
So good. My husband always looks skeptical when I say I’m cooking broccoli but then remembers that he loves this.
Easy! Delicious!
Solid broccoli side dish!
I made this to serve along side spaghetti carbonara.  As it called for garlic and Parmesan I thought it would be a good combination for an Italian themed dinner.  It was awesome, two thumbs, way up!
Awesome stuff
Even the kids like this one, it’s in the rotation.
Easy to make, at first I was apprehensive the panko would burn, but it didn't. The Kids like it too. Thanks Alton for another easy, tasty recipe. Followed as directed.
Simple and delicious! I used Asiago cheese which is a bit more pungent. I also added walnut halves when I added the panko crumbs. Turned into a one dish meal!
It tastes excellent. It was the first time I made oven-roasted broccoli, but will not be the last.

Absolutely wonderful. Make sure that you cook to eye and not to time.  The Broccolli should be beginning to brown and crisp when you pull.  And you can really add whatever cheese you want.  Smoked Gouda is awesome here.
Super easy and tasty!  Now a staple at church dinners!

This is sooo good! The only changes I made were cooking it a few minutes longer and used parmesan herb panko crumbs cause that's what I had. My husband doesn't normally like broccoli, but he really liked this!
I made this tonight and it was excellent...although I added the Parmesan cheese to the broccoli before roasting and added red pepper
This recipe was so easy to do and so good to eat. Really, this dish is a taste sensation, and when a four-year-old says "that's really good" and has seconds, you know you've done something right.

Excellent recipe for broccoli; very easy to put together and tastes more complex than it is.  
Everyone at the table enjoyed this, with requests for seconds and the recipe!!  One can't ask for much more than that.....

This was very good. I heard my husband say, "yum" while I was getting the drinks.  I said, "the chicken or the broccoli?"  He said, "the chicken."  A few minutes later as we were eating he said, "oh my god the broccoli is good too."  I didn't have panko so I used Italian season breadcrumbs.  Due to the change in breadcrumbs I probably didn't need the salt but it was still good.  The two of us finished the whole pound.

While prepping dinner my boyfriend asked "Do we need to do something to the broccoli to make it edible?"  I smiled, made this dish for the first time exactly as written, and he ate every bite, and the leftovers I wanted to save for lunch the next day.  Simple and delicious.
Amazing! Really delicious, easy and healthy!  Everyone loved it!
Alton absolutely won my heart with this recipe. Very easy and so yummy! I will absolutely make this again and would love to serve to guests. I made with grated parmesan which blended nicely.
Yummy!

Delicious and easy side dish. I usually cook it for about 15 minutes though since I find the broccoli a little under-cooked after only 8-10 minutes. I have even made it without panko and it was still really good - but the panko definitely makes it even better.
I made the recipe exactly as directed and it turned out great!  I will definitely make it again!
I didn't have any panko or parmesan, so I substituted french fried onions and smoked cheddar.  SO delicious!  I will definitely be making this again and again.
I like broccoli, but this recipe makes me crave it!! So delish and easy to make. I used garlic powder instead of garlic (overwhelming) and added some red pepper. Yum!
I agree that this recipe masks the taste of the broccoli, but it is still delicious and a great way to get excited about broccoli. Not for those who dislike garlic.
This is broccoli for people who don't like broccoli.  All you taste is the garlic.
Does anyone know the calorie count?
Excellent!  I did cook it 5-10 minutes longer than stated.

Great dish as a deviation from typical broccoli dishes.  It was very easy to make.  I will cook a little longer next time to make it softer, but it was so easy and tasted delicious.  A great side dish that takes little effort if you are cooking a lot of other things.
This is a good, easy recipe that I've now used twice, but used corn flakes instead of panko. This also works very well with cauliflower and Brussels sprouts or any combination of the three.

After doing the same broccoli preparation for years, we decided to try something new, and we are glad we did.  The broccoli florets and stalk get nice and crisp in oven, and it has a nice garlicky flavor.
This was a great dish!  I give it five stars.  My daughter loved it and she is hard to please when it comes to broccoli.
Didn't have the Parm, so I omitted the Planko.  I love garlic and fresh ground black pepper so I added extra.  YUM YUM!
I hate to be a nay sayer but I followed the directions to a T and at best, it was dry and bland.  Sorry Alton, usually I love your recipies :(
Very good, made sans panko, ala gluten free. Second time we've made it :.
This was a quick, easy switch up for something different with broccoli.  It is in the keeper box.
Are you kidding me? This broccoli is foolproof and excellent. New family favorite! Five stars, period.
Love this.  Instead of bread crumbs, I tossed some pine nuts in.  Yummy.
Love it, easy and tasty!
Good basic side. I like my broccoli a little more done so roasted it another few minutes.  Still pretty al dente at 7 minutes, as others have noted.
This is my go-to recipe for broccoli - I'm a sucker for the panko bread-crumb crunch.
Delicious! I'm always going to make my broccoli like this!

Nice combination of ingredients. I have a a method for when you are in a hurry. Just chuck the broccoli in the microwave for around 5 minutes, then combine all in oven for 15-20 minutes at a sensible temperature, putting the breadcrumbs and cheese at the top. Btw, Double awesome when mixed with cauliflower!

If, like most people, you don't know what panko is, get the toast that someone left behind and chuck it in the blender. Old bread? Toast it, let it dry out and blend it.

I was thinking that this would be great when just ready to add to a pasta or potato bake?
This was so super easy & super tasty. I did use a glass baking pan, so I guess that's why I had to cook it for almost 8 minutes before it browned.

I followed the recipe as written and was very disappointed that it was dry without much flavor, I even used italian bread crumbs.  Seems like it could have used a little more oil.  The texture of the broccoli was spot on.
This recipe is awesome. Great way to get picky eaters to have broccoli. Breadcrumbs add a nice crunchy texture that is sometimes missing with my vegetable sides.
Try it with a blend of parmesan and cheddar cheeses
This recipe was really good, the broccoli was the right amount of tender with a little crunch.  It even got my boyfriend who never eats vegetables to try broccoli.

This recipe was absolutely wonderful...even if you 'barely' like broccoli! We actually love broccoli in any form but were looking for something new. This absolutely fit the bill! We omitted the salt since we're trying to be as healthy as possible and with the Parmesan cheese, there was more than enough 'saltiness'. We've made it twice in just one week because it pairs so well with so many main dishes. I would recommend this to absolutely any family who is trying to get kids to eat it as my nieces and nephews absolutely ADORED this form and will definitely tell you that they HATE broccoli! Way to go Alton!

Thank you!!! My 6 year old daughter said "now that's what I am talking about"!  We tried roasted broccoli at a neighbors and loved it.  On the third attempt I used this recipe, and will again and again!

So many times I read reviews and have a high expectation of a dish, then am not overly impressed. This was one of them.  I roast vegetables all the time, but was thinking the panko and cheese would make it fabulous.  It was good, but not a WOW factor for me.
Wonderful!  Even my 6-year old liked it.  I omitted the panko and it was still fine.

very easy, very tasty recipe that we have had twice in the last week.  I don't even like broccoli very much, but with these seasonings and roasting, I eat all the broccoli on my plate.  One thing to note - I try to cook without grains because my husband follows a primal diet, so I omitted the bread crumbs, and it was still delicious (and lower calorie and healthier.

I hate  broccoli and I made this and I went out yesterday and bought more broccoli so I could make it again and then I am going to try it with cauliflower. I used Parmesan and not the cheddar, It war great, I did not use the stems, just the head. . It was wonderful. Easy quick and fresh.
quick, easy and tasty...thanks Alton.
Great flavor and the broccoli remained al dente, which I like.  Too much salt though! Next time I'd add 1/4 tsp. of salt instead.
Different and good.  My broccoli wasn't tender though, I think it needed more time to roast.  I tried this same receipe with cauliflower and it was also very good.

Im trying to learn to like broccoli by slowly adding it as a side to my meals. It worked with asparagus and has worked this this!!! I saw Alton talk about this dish being a good starter for people that don't like the normal steamed broccoli and he was right! This was fantastic. I did add a bit more olive oil because the tops of the broccoli seemed to soak up it up pretty quick. Other than that it was amazing!! I will be making this a lot. I forgot to add the cheese and still was great. (less calories
Nice change of pace from steaming. It has an unexpected sweetness this way. Kids liked it too.

video.name: Alton's Oven-Roasted Broccoli
video.description: The dry heat of oven-roasting brings out broccoli's natural sweetness.
